title: How to Make Italian Mushroom Soup

steps.headline: Cover the dried porcini mushrooms with boiling water in a small bowl.
steps.description: Leave it on the side for at least 15 minutes. This will allow the mushrooms to become tender and soft.

steps.headline: Place a large saucepan over a medium heat with the oil.
Cook the onions until translucent, for about 5 minutes.
Add the garlic, cremini mushrooms, and thyme.
steps.description: Stir and cook for an additional 8 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the flour and stir for a minute.
steps.description: Carefully pour the broth in and stir.

steps.headline: Drain the porcini  mushrooms, but reserve the liquid.
steps.description: Chop the mushrooms and add it, with the liquid, in the saucepan.

steps.headline: Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce to a medium-low heat, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add in the whipping cream, marsala wine, salt, and pepper.

text: Cover the dried porcini mushrooms with boiling water in a small bowl. Leave it on the side for at least 15 minutes. This will allow the mushrooms to become tender and soft. Place a large saucepan over a medium heat with the oil.  Cook the onions until translucent, for about 5 minutes.  Add the garlic, cremini mushrooms, and thyme. Stir and cook for an additional 8 minutes. Add the flour and stir for a minute. Carefully pour the broth in and stir. Drain the porcini  mushrooms, but reserve the liquid. Chop the mushrooms and add it, with the liquid, in the saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce to a medium-low heat, and simmer for 10 minutes.  Add in the whipping cream, marsala wine, salt, and pepper. Continue simmering for another 5 minutes. Serve immediately in serving bowls.
